definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: China's sharp teeth Miocene pig shall be one of them is.
sentences.chinese: 中國中新世的利齒豬即爲其中一屬。

sentences.english: Miocene formations (better: strata) are well-exposed in this area.
sentences.chinese: 本區具有出露良好的中新世地層。

sentences.english: Okinawa ocean trough and Ryukyu island arc were formed in late Miocene.
sentences.chinese: 中新世晚期，沖繩海槽和疏球島弧形成。

sentences.english: Finally, after contractive uplift in Miocene, Present Junggar Basin was formed in the end.
sentences.chinese: 最後在中新世時萎縮上隆，形成了現代的準噶爾盆地。

sentences.english: Genus of old world hominoids; miocene and pliocene.
sentences.chinese: 中新世和上新世的舊大陸人科的一屬。

sentences.english: Radiolarian distribution in surface sediments of the northern and central South China Sea.
sentences.chinese: 南海南部晚中新世的放射蟲及其環境探討。

sentences.english: The Hannuoba basalts were erupted in Miocene.
sentences.chinese: 漢諾壩玄武岩於中新世噴出。

definition: Pleistocene (geological epoch from 2m years ago, covering the most recent ice ages)
Paleozoic, geological era 545-250m years ago, covering Cambrian 寒武紀|寒武纪, Ordovician 奧陶紀|奥陶纪, Silurian 志留紀|志留纪, Devonian 泥盆紀|泥盆纪, Carboniferous 石炭紀|石炭纪, Permian 二疊紀|二叠纪
Holocene (geological period covering approx 12000 years since the last ice age)
third period/tertiary (geological era since the extinction of the dinosaurs at the Cretaceous-Tertiary boundary 65 million years ago)
fourth period/quaternary (geological period covering the recent ice ages over the last 180,000 years)
pre-Cambrian, geological period before c. 540m years ago
